content: On September 30, 1991, the Atlanta Braves secured the National League West title by defeating the Pittsburgh Pirates 6-3 at Fulton County Stadium. This victory marked a significant turnaround for the franchise, as it was the Braves' first division title since moving to Atlanta and their first postseason appearance in over a decade. Key contributions came from players like David Justice and Terry Pendleton, who helped propel the team into the playoffs, setting the stage for an eventual run to the World Series.
